item.title: Why the Two-Way Fixed Effects Model Is Difficult to Interpret, and What to Do About It
item.description: Despite their popularity, linear fixed effects models can be a painful experience for applied researchers. Our paper shows that some of these problems stem from the wide application of the two-way fixed effects model as opposed to the simpler and easier to interpret one-way fixed effects models.
